name: maintenance, barge | maintenance, barge | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9533/documentation

The dataset represents the maintenance of a barge with an average total capacity of 1000 t/vessel.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Barge maintenance starting with the painting of the barge.

The activity ends with the maintenance of one barge. The dataset includes the use of paint and emissions of the solvent of the paint as NMVOC. The dataset doesn't incude teh consumption of lubricates.
category: C:Manufacturing/33:Repair and installation of machinery and equipment/331:Repair of fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment/3315:Repair of transport equipment, except motor vehicles

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data is derived from an assessment of one barge, with a load capacity of 2800t Bialonski (1990; Engelkamp (1993) as quoted in Maibach et al. (1999). This data was adjusted to model a barge, representing the current average total capacity for  a barge (1000 t/vessel). For inland waterways vessels we assume that they are painted 10 times in their entire life span.;References:;Bialonski W. (1990) Spezifischer Energieeinsatz im Verkehr – Ermittlung und Vergleich der spezifischen Energieverbräuche. Forschungsbericht FE Nr. 90 247/88, im Auftrag des Bundesministers für Verkehr (ausgeführt am Verkehrswissenschaftlichen Institut der Rheinisch-Westfälischen Technischen Hochschule Aachen), Bonn;Engelkamp P. (1993) Stellungnahme des Europäischen Entwicklungszent-rums für die Binnenschifffahrt e.V. Duisburg zum Fragenkatalog für die öffentliche Anhörung der Enquete Komission " Schutz des Menschen und der Umwelt". Enquete Komission zum Thema "Mobilität - Darstellung, Bewertung und Optimierung von Stoffströmen., Bonn;Maibach M., Peter D. and Seiler B. (1999) Ökoinventar Transporte: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Transportsystemen und den Einbezug von Transportsystemen in Ökobilanzen. Technischer Schlussbericht. In: Schweizerischer Nationalfonds zur Förderung der wissenschaftlichen Forschung (ed. SPP Umwelt M.). 2nd Edition. INFRAS, Zürich
